ygData.messageBody:
Hold on a sec. Are you sure that your riposte damage is correlated to *your* weapon damage & not the creatures attack (i.e. you are turning its attack back on it)?

Some folks posted some research on here a couple of days ago & it didn't look like the riposte damage was the same as their weapon damage. It looked like you'd get both your normal swings & a riposte (dual wield) between taunts (measurement of a turn). Can anyone bear this out?

If so, this changes the dynamic of your 1h vs 2h argument.

I'm not trying to start a fight here...just curious how this thing works


> ** Original Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Now about 1hs vs 2hs Re: Rangers and warriors
> ** Original Sender: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
> ** Original Date: Mon, 24 May 1999 16:03:25 -0500

> ** Original Message follows...

>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> Correct, but you only get a single attack of your primary weapon, you do not get a chance for a dual or double attack on a reposte....to my knowledge. So I can see getting to a point where 2h slash may surpass 1h slash, even against red mobs, because you may be able to get several reposte hits in one round.
>
> >>> David Rogers <derogers334@...> 5.24.99 3:42:07 PM >>>
> From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
>
> --- Jason Coan <COANJ@...> wrote:
> > Reposte is a counter attack. When you reposte you
> > get an extra swing with your primary weapon. You
> > can reposte multiple times per round. And I'm
> > learning that reposte is damn cool when weilding a
> > 2h that hits for up to 44 :)
>
> So everytime you pass your riposte check successfully, you get another
> attack *on top* of all your normal and double attack and dual weild
> attacks?
